https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: When you read this poem, what color comes to mind? Find a background, text color, and text effect that matches the feeling of this poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions: _When you read this poem, what feeling do you get? What color matches that feeling?_ - Connect blocks from the toolbox under when run to build your program. - Find a **background** and **text effect** that matches the **mood** of this poem. - Change the **colors** of your effects or text. - Click "Run" to animate the poem.

authored_hints.add_background_effect:
Find a background block like this one:
[blockly block][0]

and find a text effect block like this one: 

[blockly block][1]

Connect these blocks under `when run` in your Workspace.
authored_hints.add_more_effects:
Add in more colors or effects to help create the mood of this poem. 

[blockly block][0]

callouts.run_button: Test your animation with this button.

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: Did the sounds and images match the mood of the poem?

contained levels.long_instructions: ## Predict Read the poem. What sounds and images come to mind? After you type your answer, press "Run" to watch and listen to the poem animation.

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: Add sounds to your program to change how the poem feels while you're reading it.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions:
Adding **sounds** and **music** to your program can change how the poem feels while you're reading it. 

-   Add a new sound or music block to your code.
-   Find sounds or music that match the mood of the poem.

authored_hints.poetry_sound_hint:
Find this block:
[blockly block][0]
or this block: 

[blockly block][1]

Connect it under `when run` in your Workspace.
authored_hints.more_code:
Add in more effects and colors to go with the sound you chose. 
[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: Let's use events to change the animation when the poem mentions something new.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions:
Use **events** to change your animation when the poem mentions something new. 

-   Find a **line** in the poem where the mood shifts or something new is introduced. 
-   Add **colors** or **effects** to match a new **line** in the poem. 
-   Make sure the effect changes when the line you want appears on the screen.

authored_hints.do_effect_hint:
This new `do effect` block will add a new effect once. 
[blockly block][0]

You can stack more than one `do effect` one top of each other to make the effect last longer. 
[blockly block][1]
authored_hints.background_effect_hint:
You can add other effects under an event block with code that looks like this:
[blockly block][0]
authored_hints.more_events_hint:
You can use more than one event in your program. Try using two events with different effects to match new lines in the poem. 

[blockly block][0]

[blockly block][1]

contained levels.long_instructions: ## Predict Read the poem. What images come to mind? After you type your answer, press "Run" to watch the poem animation.

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: Authors use imagery to paint a picture in the reader's mind. You can add sprites to illustrate your poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions: Poets use words to paint a picture in the reader's mind. Add **sprites** to go with the images that come to your mind when you read the poem. - Add a make new sprite block to your code. - Choose a costume for your sprite. _Extra Challenge:_ Connect a make new sprite block to an event to make a new sprite appear when a new image is introduced in the poem.

authored_hints.location_hint:
Each sprite has a **location**. You can set the location by clicking the pin on this block: 

[blockly block][0]

-   Click the pin [][1] on the location block then choose a new position for your sprite on the screen.
-   Press the "Run" button when your code is finished.
authored_hints.remove_hint:
You can remove a sprite at a certain line number. You can add a new sprite to take its place: 

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: Sprites can do certain actions or behaviors over and over while the program runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions: Sprites can do certain actions or **behaviors** over and over while the program runs. - Add a sprite begins block to your code. - Explore different sprite behaviors. - Choose a behavior that matches your poem. _Extra Challenge:_ Add a sprite begins block to an **event**!

authored_hints.add_behavior:
Add a `sprite begins` block to your code. Make sure you already made the sprite you are giving a behavior to. 

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.short_instructions: You can change the size of a sprite you already made.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions: You can change the **size** of a sprite you already made. - Change the size of your sprite by using the new set size block. - Make sure to choose a size other than 100.

authored_hints.size hint:
Find this block and click the `150`.
[blockly block][0]

What happens when the number is `25`? 
[blockly block][1]

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions:
The freedom of a blank page! 

-   Illustrate a poem however you'd like and share it with your friends.
-   Use the "Select Poem" dropdown menu in the top left to select a poem or enter your own!

callouts.poetry_selector: Select any poem, or enter your own!

dsls.markdown:
##Plan Your Poem

It's time to plan your own poem.

>You should include: > - Something you love doing. > - Someone important to you. > - Some of your favorite things. **Ready to start planning?** Use this resource. **Looking for a topic?** Use this resource.

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions:
**Code Your Poem!**

Now it's time to animate your Poem. Enter your own poem and then add your code! 

_Hint: Go to the next level to review any coding skills._

dsls.description: Choose from the activities below to refresh your memory on how to add code to your time capsule poem! You can pick multiple options and do more than one!

csc_timecapsule_review1_ -l3.short_instructions: When you read this poem, what comes to mind? Find a background that matches the mood of this poem.
csc_timecapsule_review1_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s give our poem a background!** - Connect a set background to block under when run. - To choose a different background, click on the Backgrounds tab above the play area. - When you're finished, click "Run". _Bonus: Try out different backgrounds, frames, and effects._

csc_timecapsule_review2_ -l3.short_instructions: Now add a text color to your poem.
csc_timecapsule_review2_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s change the text color of our poem!** - Connect a set text color block under when run. - Choose a color that you can see against the background. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review3_ -l3.short_instructions: Set a text effect for your poem.
csc_timecapsule_review3_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s find a text effect that matches the mood of our poem!** - Connect a set text effect block under when run. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review4_ -l3.short_instructions: Add sounds to your program to change how the poem feels while you're reading it.
csc_timecapsule_review4_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s find a sound that matches the feeling of our time capsule poem!** - Connect a play sound or play music block under when run. - Choose a sound or music that matches the feeling of the poem. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review5_ -l3.short_instructions: Use events to change the animation when the poem mentions something new.
csc_timecapsule_review5_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s add an event block to change a background, text effect, or sound to match a line in our poem!** - Drag a when line shows block into the workspace. - Connect a set background, set text effect, or play sound block underneath. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review6_ -l3.short_instructions: Add a sprite to illustrate your time capsule poem. Sprites can do certain actions or behaviors over and over while the program runs.
csc_timecapsule_review6_ -l3.long_instructions: **Let’s add a sprite and give it a behavior!** - Connect a make new sprite block under when run. - Then, connect a sprite begins block and choose a behavior. - When you're finished, click "Run". _Bonus: Add an event block to make the sprite show up or disappear with a specific line._

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-2023/le.long_instructions:
_You're finished, and it's time to share your poem! Great work!_

-   Make sure all of your code works like you'd expect.
-   Add any finishing touches.

dsls.markdown:
##Share Your Poem App
**Now that you have coded your poem, it's time to share it out!** As you view your classmates' project think about a “glow”, a “grow”, and a “question” you can write for your partner: - A “glow” is something they did well - A “grow” is something they can change or improve - A “question” is something you want to know more about
**Ready to get started?** Use this resource to share feedback with your partner.
